perturbation.original_text: Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with thefollowing provisions: Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the service fee ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge Service Fee from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be equal to the amount of profits gained by Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. Party B shall have the right to adjust the amount of Service Fee at its own discretion, without the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries. Party A shall cause its subsidiaries to pay the Service Fee in respect of Party B's Services provided to such subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text: Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with thefollowing provisions: Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the commission ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge Service Fee from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be equal to the amount of profits gained by Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. Party B shall have the right to adjust the amount of Service Fee at its own discretion, without the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries. Party A shall cause its subsidiaries to pay the Service Fee in respect of Party B's Services provided to such subsidiaries.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "service fee" to "commission" introduces ambiguity. While the parenthetical reference initially equates 'commission' with 'Service Fee,' the subsequent text only uses 'Service Fee,' implying they are distinct. This creates an in-text contradiction regarding the calculation and adjustment of the fee. Is it a commission based on a percentage, or a service fee equal to the profits?
perturbation.contradicted_text: Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with thefollowing provisions: Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the commission ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge Service Fee from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be equal to the amount of profits gained by Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. Party B shall have the right to adjust the amount of Service Fee at its own discretion, without the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries. Party A shall cause its subsidiaries to pay the Service Fee in respect of Party B's Services provided to such subsidiaries.

perturbation.original_text: The Parties agree that any and all intellectual property researched and developed, created and invented by the Parties (including their employees) in the course of performance of this Agreement shall be owned by Party B. For the purpose of this Article 12.3, "Intellectual Property" means the patent, patent application right, trademark, service mark, logo, image, trade name, internet domain name, design right, copyright (including copyright of computer software) and moral rights, database right, right of semiconductor design drawing, utility model, proprietary technology and other intellectual property that are registered and unregistered including those that have applied for registration, as well as all other rights or protection methods with same or similar effect on a global scope.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties agree that any and all intellectual property researched and developed, created and invented by the Parties (including their employees) in the course of performance of this Agreement shall be owned by Party B. For the purpose of this Article 12.3, "Intellectual Creations" means the patent, patent application right, trademark, service mark, logo, image, trade name, internet domain name, design right, copyright (including copyright of computer software) and moral rights, database right, right of semiconductor design drawing, utility model, proprietary technology and other intellectual property that are registered and unregistered including those that have applied for registration, as well as all other rights or protection methods with same or similar effect on a global scope.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the term "Intellectual Property" to "Intellectual Creations" within the definition, we create a contradiction. The section initially implies that Party B owns all 'intellectual property', but then defines Intellectual Creations separately. If the defined term is different than what is written previously, it becomes ambigious to the ownership of other Intellectual Property that is not defined.
perturbation.contradicted_text: The Parties agree that any and all intellectual property researched and developed, created and invented by the Parties (including their employees) in the course of performance of this Agreement shall be owned by Party B. For the purpose of this Article 12.3, "Intellectual Creations" means the patent, patent application right, trademark, service mark, logo, image, trade name, internet domain name, design right, copyright (including copyright of computer software) and moral rights, database right, right of semiconductor design drawing, utility model, proprietary technology and other intellectual property that are registered and unregistered including those that have applied for registration, as well as all other rights or protection methods with same or similar effect on a global scope.

perturbation.original_text: Party B fails to provide Party B's Services to Party A for more than three consecutive years due to the force majeure event.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B fails to provide Party B's deliverables to Party A for more than three consecutive years due to the force majeure event.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Party B's Services' to 'Party B's deliverables' changes the type of failure condition. If Party B fails to provide deliverables but can still fulfill the service requirement in other form or means, it is no longer considered as termination. The meaning of not providing service is changed by specifying deliverables. This alters the nature of the failure.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Party B fails to provide Party B's deliverables to Party A for more than three consecutive years due to the force majeure event.
